intro: Telosiphonia lanuginosa var. oaxacensis, commonly known as the Oaxaca velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
